Literature Review: The neural proteome of cephalopods has been extensively studied, revealing a complex array of molecular mechanisms that underlie their remarkable cognitive abilities. RNA editing, a process that recodes codons, has been found to be a key player in this process. Recent studies have shown that cephalopods have an unusually large number of Aâ†’I RNA editing sites, which recode codons and contribute to the complexity of their neural transcriptomes. This literature review aims to summarize the current state of knowledge on RNA editing in cephalopods, with a focus on its adaptive significance and noncanonical aspects.
